snippet: Leaders of the New York Legislature propose that standardized tests aligned with the new Common Core curriculum standards be excluded, for now, from the state’s new system for grading teachers.
abstract: New York State Legislature leaders propose that standardized tests aligned with new Common Core curriculum standards be excluded, for at least two years, from state’s new system for grading teachers; change, if made, will affect teachers responsible for teaching math and English in fourth through eighth grades.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of the New York Legislature propose that standardized tests aligned with the new Common Core curriculum standards be excluded, for now, from the state’s new system for grading teachers.

headline.main: A Call to Ignore Exam Results When Evaluating Educators
headline.print_headline: A Call to Ignore Exam Results When Evaluating Educators
